title: light
comment: The brightness that enables sight in the darkness. Scripture often uses light as a symbol of the saving presence of God in a fallen world, with darkness being used as a symbol of sin or the absence of God.

children.title: light, natural
children.comment: Scripture stresses that every source of light (sun, moon and stars) is created by God, and subject to him.

children.title: God is the source of natural light
The pillars of cloud and fire
light, spiritual
children.comment: Light is often used in Scripture as a symbol of the presence of God in the world. It is often especially associated with the word of God, the salvation brought about by God, or the person of Jesus Christ.

children.title: Light as a symbol of God
Satan as an imitator of light
Light as a symbol of God's favour towards his people
Light as a symbol of God's word
Light as a symbol of salvation
Light as a symbol of Jesus Christ
light, and people of God
children.comment: Scripture often uses light as a symbol of the people of God, and especially the manner in which believers are able and required to reflect the glory of God in a dark world of sin.

children.title: The people of God as the light of the world
Examples of believers acting as light to the world

secondaryrefs.comment: the righteous ruler, fully realised in Jesus Christ

children.title: God is the source of the light of his people
God and his law as the source of light
The gospel of forgiveness as a source of light
The people of God are called to live in his light
